title: Jamaica at the Olympics
text:
<a href="Jamaica">Jamaica</a> first participated at the <a href="Olympic%20Games">Olympic Games</a> in 1948, and has sent athletes to compete in every <a href="Summer%20Olympic%20Games">Summer Olympic Games</a> since then. In 1960, Jamaican athletes competed as part of the <a href="West%20Indies%20Federation">West Indies Federation</a> team.
Jamaica has also participated in the <a href="Winter%20Olympic%20Games">Winter Olympic Games</a> since 1988, with the <a href="Jamaica%20national%20bobsleigh%20team">Jamaica national bobsleigh team</a> achieving some fame.
Jamaican athletes have won a total of 87 medals, with all but one medal won in <a href="Sport%20of%20athletics">athletics</a>, and all but three of those in the individual and relay <a href="Sprint%20%28running%29">sprint</a> events.
The <a href="National%20Olympic%20Committee">National Olympic Committee</a> for Jamaica is the <a href="Jamaica%20Olympic%20Association">Jamaica Olympic Association</a>, and was founded in 1936.
